text: Berke Özer (born 25 May 2000) is a Turkish professional footballer, who is playing at Westerlo competing at Belgian First Division B, on loan from Turkish outfit Fenerbahçe. ==Club career== ===Fenerbahçe S.K.=== Fenerbahçe signed in Berke Özer along with his team-mate Barış Alıcı from Altınordu, on 10 July 2018, with an altogether €4.00 million transfer fee. Özer was excluded from 23-player-squad submitted for group stage of 2018–19 UEFA Europa League Group D fixtures. On 6 December 2018, Özer made his debut for Fenerbahçe against Giresunspor in 1st leg encounter of 5th round at 2018–19 Turkish Cup where he earned a clean sheet, following the final score of 1–0. On 20 July 2019, Özer joined Belgian First Division B outfit Westerlo on loan for 2019–20 season. On 3 August 2019 he made his debut against Lommel SK on Belgian First Division B encounter which ended 2–0 in favour of Westerlo. On 14 August 2019, he was selected at Team of the Week following home game against Oud-Heverlee Leuven, ending 1–0 for Westerlo's favour at week 2. Following 2 back-to-back clean sheets, he conceded for his first time in league at week 3 home game up against K.S.V. Roeselare that ended 4–1 in favour of Westerlo on 17 August 2019. ==International career== In 2017 June, Özer was called up to Turkey national football team by then-coach Fatih Terim for the friendly game to be held against Macedonia national football team. ==Career statistics== ===Club=== {| class="wikitable" style="text-align: center;" |- !rowspan="2"|Club !rowspan="2"|Season !colspan="2"|League !colspan="2"|CupIncludes Turkish Cup and Turkish Super Cup !colspan="2"|Europe !colspan="2"|Total |- !Apps !Goals !Apps !Goals !Apps !Goals !Apps !Goals |- |rowspan="3" valign="center"|Altınordu |2016–17 |2||0||0||0||colspan="2"|—||2||0 |- |2017–18 |5||0||1||0||colspan="2"|—||6||0 |- !Total !7!!0!!1!!0!!0!!0!!8!!0 |- |rowspan="2" valign="center"|Fenerbahçe |2018–19 |0||0|||1||0||0||0||1||0 |- !Total !0!!0!!1!!0!!0!!0!!1!!0 |- |rowspan="2" valign="center"|Westerlo (loan) |2019–20 |22||0|||0||0||colspan="2"|—||22||0 |- !Total !22!!0!!0!!0!!0!!0!!22!!0 |- !colspan="2"|Career total !29!!0!!2!!0!!0!!0!!31!!0 |} ==Achievements== ; Turkey U-17 * UEFA European Under-17 Championship (Semi Finalist): 2017 ==References== ==External links== * Profile at TFF * Category:2000 births Category:Living people Category:People from İzmir Category:Association football goalkeepers Category:Turkish footballers Category:Turkish expatriate footballers Category:Altınordu S.K. footballers Category:Fenerbahçe S.K. footballers Category:K.V.C.
